item.description:
Paddle and Picnic at Cochituate

This is a joint event with The North Boston Kayaking and Canoe Meetup Group!

Join us for a day of fun and food at one of our close by state parks. Cochituate is a series of three joined lakes. All three are open to power boats, but the top lake is restricted to 5 mph. This event is suitable for beginning paddlers is kid friendly. Cochituate has on site boat rental, the rates are listed below.

The park has a $5 entry fee.

Seeing as this is a large territory with lots of people, it will be a challenge to have a meeting spot. The plan is to stake out a spot near the boat rental. Leo will prop up a purple whitewater kayak as a sign.

Please put what you want to bring in your rsvp.

Nasty weather will cancel this event.

Please email me with any questions.


The official park website:
http://www.mass.gov/d...

Map of the lake
http://www.paddlebost...

from the Massachusetts Turnpike: Take Exit 13 (Natick/Framingham). After the toll, bear left, following the signs for Rt.30 East. Follow Rt.30 East through two sets of lights. The Park entrance is the next right. There may be a $5 fee to park your vehicle.

from Route 30 heading west: Follow Route 30 West through Weston and Natick. After crossing over Lake Cochituate and the Massachusetts Turnpike, look for the Park entrance on the left. There may be a $5 fee to park your vehicle.

from Route 9 heading west: Exit Route 9 at Speen St./Mass Pike and bear right when the road forks. Immediately after Home Depot, make a right onto Cochituate Road (Route 30). After passing the next light, the Park entrance is on the right. There may be a $5 fee to park your vehicle.


? COCHITUATE ON-SITE RENTAL RATES 2007 ?


BOAT TYPE PER HOUR PER DAY
standard canoe $15 $60
large canoe (4-5 adults) $20 $80
single kayak (1 adult) $14 $56
double kayak (2 adults) $16 $64
quad kayak (3-4 adults) $20 $80
kid's kayak (age 6-12) $7 $28
paddleboat (1-2 adults) $16 $64
large paddleboat (3-4 adults) $18 $72
rowboat (1-4 adults) $16 $64
item.name: Paddle and Picnic
